original: chos kyi 'khor lo ni rab tu bskor /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ni rab tu bskor /

original: chos thams cad la ni mnga' brnyes /
analyzed: chos thams cad la ni mnga' brnyes /

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i tshul ni rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i tshul ni rab tu mkhyen /

original: dbang po dam pa'i mchog ni brnyes sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba legs par 'joms pa la ni mkhas /
analyzed: dbang po dam pa'i mchog ni brnyes sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba legs par 'joms pa la ni mkhas /
translated: He had attained the supreme, highest sense faculties. He was skilled in the complete destruction of the latent tendencies of the afflictions of all beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa ni rgyun ma bcad cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa ni rgyun ma bcad cing /

original: @123b dge slong brgya stong phrag drug cu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig ste /
analyzed: @123b dge slong brgya stong phrag drug cu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig ste /

original: thams cad kyang cang shes pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang cang shes pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: They all had the mind of one who knows,

original: yang dag par shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: yang dag par shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba /

original: dmigs pa med pa'i chos las nges par byung ba /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i chos las nges par byung ba /

original: spyod lam mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: spyod lam mdzes pa phun sum tshogs pa /

original: sbyin pa'i gnas chen por gyur pa /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas chen por gyur pa /

analyzed: mngon par shes pa chen po'i ye shes la gzud pa'i sgor 'jug pa /

analyzed: theg pa thams cad theg pa gcig tu mtshungs pa nyid la yang dag par gzhol ba /

translated: It is the Dharma that is in accord with the essence.

original: bdud kyi 'khor thams cad shin tu rnam par 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi 'khor thams cad shin tu rnam par 'joms par byed pa /

analyzed: tshul bzhin gyi chos la gzud pa'i sgor 'jug pa /
translated: It is the Dharma that enters the gateway of proper practice.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad 'dul ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / lta bar gyur pa thams cad 'dul ba /
translated: It is the Dharma that tames all afflictions and views.

original: chags pa med pa'i shes rab dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i shes rab dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa /
translated: It is the Dharma that is in accord with non-attached wisdom and insight.ğŸ”½It is the Dharma that teaches the wisdom of the skill in the dedication that is infinite and unequaled.

original: mtha' yas shing mtshungs pa med pa'i bsngo ba la mkhas pa'i thabs kyi ye shes bstan pa; sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa /

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi sgor 'jug pa /ğŸ”½chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin @125a *//
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi sgor 'jug pa / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin @125a *//
translated: It is the Dharma that enters the gateway of the blessing of unobstructed wisdom.

original: du shin tu gtan la bab par bstan pa /
analyzed: du shin tu gtan la bab par bstan pa /
translated: It is the Dharma that teaches the certainty of all phenomena just as they are.

original: mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa'i mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa /

translated: It is not a domain of consciousness of smell.ğŸ”½It is not a domain of consciousness of the tongue.ğŸ”½It is not a domain of consciousness of taste.

original: lus kyi ma yin /
analyzed: lus kyi ma yin /

original: reg bya'i ma yin /
analyzed: reg bya'i ma yin /
translated: It is not a domain of consciousness of touch.

original: yid kyi ma yin /
analyzed: yid kyi ma yin /

original: chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ma yin no //

original: yang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dmigs pa thams cad la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni dmigs pa thams cad la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: â€œFurthermore, the recollection of the Buddha is not to dwell on any object.

original: mtshan ma thams cad mi ldang ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad mi ldang ba'o //
translated: It is not to give rise to any sign.

original: g-yo ba dang / sems pa dang / bskyod pa thams cad kyi rgyu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang / sems pa dang / bskyod pa thams cad kyi rgyu ba med pa'o //
translated: It is without movement, thought, or any kind of activity.

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa mi skyed pa'o //

original: dbang po dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / rnam par grol ba'i mtshan nyid thams cad kyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'o //

original: sems gcig nas gcig tu nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems gcig nas gcig tu nying mtshams sbyor ba med pa'o //
translated: It does not connect one thought to another.

original: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: It is the pacification of all thoughts and concepts.

original: nyes pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba bcom pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba bcom pa'o //
translated: It is the destruction of faults, attachment, and anger.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid rnam par chad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid rnam par chad pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of the characteristics of causes.

original: pha rol dang / tshu rol dang / dpung dang / mthar 'dzin pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol dang / tshu rol dang / dpung dang / mthar 'dzin pa thams cad yang dag par chad pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of all extremes of this side and the other side, of armies, and of ends.

original: sgro btags pa med pas 'od gsal ba'o //ğŸ”½phye ba med pa'i phyir dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sgro btags pa med pas 'od gsal ba'o // phye ba med pa'i phyir dga' ba med pa'o //

original: myang ba med pa'i phyir bde ba med pa'o //
analyzed: myang ba med pa'i phyir bde ba med pa'o //

analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba'i yongs su gdung ba med pa'o // 'bad pa @136a *//

translated: It is the characteristic of liberation, being free from all effort.

original: gzugs med pas lus med pa'o //

original: tshor ba med pas tshor bar gyur pa med pa'o //

original: mdud pa med pas mdud pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mdud pa med pas mdud pa dang bral ba'o //

original: 'du mi byed pas 'dus ma byas pa'o //

original: rnam par shes pa med pas rnam par mi rig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pas rnam par mi rig pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: mi 'dzin pas len pa med pa'o //

original: mi gtong bas dor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi gtong bas dor ba med pa'o //

original: gnas med pas mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas med pas mi gnas pa'o //

original: tshor ba dang bral bas mi 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang bral bas mi 'dug pa'o //

original: mi 'byung bas med par mi 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: dran pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos thams cad kyis ma bzung ba /

original: len pa med pas 'dor ba med pa /

original: lus kyi las rnam gsum gyi sdom pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir lus kyi bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las rnam gsum gyi sdom pa yongs su dag pa'i phyir lus kyi bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //

analyzed: ngag gi nyes pa rnam bzhi yongs su spang ba'i phyir ngag gi bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba @144b med pa'i phyir sems kyi bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba @144b med pa'i phyir sems kyi bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //

original: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa'i phyir thos pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: chos la slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa'i phyir thos pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems la sbyor ba'i phyir slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud med pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //

original: sems can gzhan byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la rab tu 'dzud pa'i phyir sems can gzhan byang chub kyi sems yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i bsam pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba mi zad pa'o //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su spyad pa'ang tshad med pa ste /
translated: the generosity of the bodhisattvas is also immeasurable.

original: tshe dang / spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar bstan pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang / spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar bstan pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate lifespan, eloquence, happiness, strength, and complexion, they give food to those who desire food.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / sred pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir btung ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / sred pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir btung ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving drinks to those who want drinks, in order to eliminate all afflictions and cravings.

original: bde ba dang / 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving vehicles to those who want vehicles, in order to gather all happiness and prosperity.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin @149a *//
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin @149a *//
translated: Giving clothes to those who want clothes, in order to purify the golden complexion of modesty and shame.

original: pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su gzigs par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su gzigs par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving lamps to those who want lamps, in order to see with the divine eye of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir rol mo 'dod pa rnams la rol mo'i sgra sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir rol mo 'dod pa rnams la rol mo'i sgra sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving music to those who want music, in order to purify the divine ear of the Tathagatas.

original: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spos kyis byug pa'i phyir spos dang / byug pa 'dod pa rnams la spos dang / byug pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spos kyis byug pa'i phyir spos dang / byug pa 'dod pa rnams la spos dang / byug pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Incense is giving incense and ointments to those who want them, in order to anoint them with the fragrance of morality, learning, and concentration.

original: gzungs dang / spobs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir me tog phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la me tog phreng ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs dang / spobs pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir me tog phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la me tog phreng ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: Garlands is giving garlands to those who want them, in order to obtain the flowers of mnemonic powers, eloquence, and the factors of enlightenment.

original: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin pa'o //
translated: Powdered incenses is giving powdered incenses to those who want them, in order to obtain a pleasing bodily fragrance.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir bro thams cad 'dod pa rnams la bro thams cad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir bro thams cad 'dod pa rnams la bro thams cad sbyin pa'o //
translated: Flavors is giving all flavors to those who want them, in order to perfect the supreme flavor of the marks of a great person.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyabs dang; mgon dang / dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyabs dang; mgon dang / dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Beds and seats is giving beds and seats to those who want them, in order to be a refuge, protection, support, and defense for all beings.

original: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spong ba dang / lha dang // tshangs pa'i gnas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spong ba dang / lha dang // tshangs pa'i gnas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of bedding to those who want bedding, in order to obtain the bed of the Tathagatas and the bed of the Dharma.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi @149b snying po rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi @149b snying po rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of seats to those who want seats, in order to obtain the vajra-throne at the site of enlightenment in all the great trichiliocosm.

original: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad yongs su bkang ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad yongs su bkang ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of necessities to those who want necessities, in order to obtain all the necessities of enlightenment.

original: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde ba yongs su bkang ba'i phyir na ba dang / sman 'dod pa thams cad la sman sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde ba yongs su bkang ba'i phyir na ba dang / sman 'dod pa thams cad la sman sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of medicine and care to the sick, in order to obtain the medicine of immortality and the bliss of immortality.

original: rang dbang dang / rang nyams dang / rang 'byung gi ye shes yongs su bkang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran pho dang / bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dbang dang / rang nyams dang / rang 'byung gi ye shes yongs su bkang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran pho dang / bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' gift of male and female servants is in order to fill with freedom, with self-mastery, and with self-arisen intuition.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvas' gift of gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch-shells, moon-stones, corals,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su bkang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang /ğŸ”½rin po che thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su bkang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byu ru dang / rin po che thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: and all precious things is in order to fill with the thirty-two marks of a superman.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyan sna tshogs sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyan sna tshogs sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' gift of various ornaments is in order to perfect the eighty minor characteristics.

original: gtsug gtor bltar mi mthong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtsug gi nor bu dang / cod pan sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug gtor bltar mi mthong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtsug gi nor bu dang / cod pan sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' gift of their crown-jewel and diadem is in order to attain the invisible crown-protrusion.

original: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rta dang / bal glang dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung dang / bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //ğŸ”½bsam gtan @150a *//
analyzed: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rta dang / bal glang dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung dang / bzhon pa sbyin pa'o // bsam gtan @150a *//
translated: The bodhisattvas' gift of horses, elephants, chariots, infantry, and vehicles is for the sake of perfecting the Great Vehicle.

original: gyi yan lag dang / yan lag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med khang dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / gtsug lag khang yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gyi yan lag dang / yan lag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med khang dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / gtsug lag khang yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' gift of gardens, palaces, hermitages, and monasteries is for the sake of perfecting the limbs of meditation and the limbs of the groups.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dga' ba mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bu pho dang / bu mo dang / chung ma dang / sdug pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dga' ba mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bu pho dang / bu mo dang / chung ma dang / sdug pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' gift of sons, daughters, and loved ones is for the sake of delighting in unexcelled perfect enlightenment and manifesting perfect enlightenment.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su dgang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su dgang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattvas is the giving of their wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses in order to fill the treasury and granary of the holy Dharma.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang; rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po byang chub kyi snying por 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / yul 'khor dang; rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang /
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattvas is the giving of their cities, towns, villages, kingdoms, and royal palaces in order to go to the seat of awakening, the kingship of the holy Dharma endowed with all aspects.

original: dzambu'i gling dang / gling bzhi dang / rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dzambu'i gling dang / gling bzhi dang / rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattvas is the giving of their entire dominion, the four continents, and the kingship in order to attain the sovereignty of the Dharma.

original: chos la dga' zhing mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / rtsed mo thams cad gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dga' zhing mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / rtsed mo thams cad gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of the bodhisattvas is the giving of all their pleasures, amusements, and enjoyments in order to attain the joy and delight of the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi rkang pas byang chub kyi @150b snying por 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rkang pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi rkang pas byang chub kyi @150b snying por 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rkang pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas give their feet in order to go to the site of awakening on the feet of the holy Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la dam pa'i chos kyi lag pa sbyin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag mthil sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dam pa'i chos kyi lag pa sbyin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag mthil sbyin pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas give the palms of their hands in order to give the gift of the holy Dharma to all sentient beings.

original: dbang po nyams pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rna ba dang / sna sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rna ba dang / sna sbyin pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas give their ears and noses in order to perfect those whose faculties are incomplete.

original: sems can thams cad la sgrib pa med pa sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mig sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sgrib pa med pa sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mig sbyin pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas give their eyes in order to attain the unobstructed eye of a Buddha and the eye of Dharma for all sentient beings.

original: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par 'phags pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yan lag gi dam pa mgo sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par 'phags pa'i mchog thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yan lag gi dam pa mgo sbyin pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas give their head, the most excellent of all their limbs, in order to attain the wisdom of omniscience, which is the most excellent of all the qualities of the three realms.

original: snying po med pa'i lus las snying po blang zhing nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sha dang / khrag yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa'i lus las snying po blang zhing nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sha dang / khrag yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of marrow and bone is in order to attain the body of a buddha, which is as solid and firm as a diamond, and as hard as the body of Narayana.ğŸ”½â€œMoreover, Venerable ÅšÄriputra,ğŸ”½the bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their head is in order to attain the head of omniscience.

original: 'jam pa dang / snum pa dang / gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phags pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa dang / snum pa dang / gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi phags pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their eyes is in order to attain the eyes of insight.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their flesh is in order to attain the flesh of great love.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their blood is in order to attain the blood of the Dharma.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their marrow and bone is in order to attain the indestructible vajra body.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their hands is in order to take hold of all beings with the hands of Dharma.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their feet is in order to go where all beings are with the feet of mindfulness.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing sra ba dang / sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rus pa dang / rkang sbyin pa'o //ğŸ”½btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje ltar mi shigs shing sra ba dang / sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rus pa dang / rkang sbyin pa'o // btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their ears, nose, and so on, is in order to attain the unobstructed ear, nose, and so on, of the thus-gone ones.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their limbs is in order to attain the limbs of the path of the noble ones.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their major and minor body parts is in order to attain the major and minor marks of a great being.

original: gzhan yang / byang chub sems @151a *//ğŸ”½sems dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang / byang chub sems @151a *// sems dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their kingdom is in order to attain the kingdom of the Dharma.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their retinue is in order to gather the retinue of the noble ones.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their children is in order to beget the children of the buddhas.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their wives is in order to be free of desire.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their wealth is in order to be free of miserliness.ğŸ”½The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their elephants, horses, chariots, and so on, is in order to attain the vehicle of the noble ones.

original: sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sems can la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: The bodhisattvasâ€™ gift of their slaves and servants is in order to attain the service

original: nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is motivated by pride.

original: 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa dang / 'dzem pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa dang / 'dzem pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is motivated by fear, anxiety, or shame.

original: mgron du gnyer te yongs su mi gtong ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: mgron du gnyer te yongs su mi gtong ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with the expectation of receiving something in return.

original: ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is less than what was promised.

original: bzang po yod pa la bzang po ma yin pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: bzang po yod pa la bzang po ma yin pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with the thought that the gift is not good, when in fact it is good.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is not given with a higher motivation.

original: g-yo dang / sgyus sbyin pa med do //ğŸ”½bcos pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: g-yo dang / sgyus sbyin pa med do // bcos pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with deceit or pretense.ğŸ”½There is no generosity that is given with a sense of duty.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / rgod pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang / rgod pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with a sense of entitlement or with arrogance.

original: log pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do //ğŸ”½gti mug gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: log pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do // gti mug gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with a deluded state of mind.

original: tshel ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: tshel ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with a sense of loss.

original: phyin ci log gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with a mistaken state of mind.

original: ma dad par sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: ma dad par sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given without faith.

original: mi dga' bar sbyin pa med do //ğŸ”½nye bar gnas pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: mi dga' bar sbyin pa med do //ğŸ”½nye bar gnas pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given without joy.ğŸ”½There is no generosity that is given with the expectation of receiving something in return.

original: ngor bltas te sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: ngor bltas te sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to reputation.

original: sems can tha dad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sems can tha dad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to the distinctions between sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas 'dam zhing sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas 'dam zhing sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to the status of being a recipient of generosity.

original: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin par brnyas shing sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin par brnyas shing sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to the status of not being a recipient of generosity with regard to any sentient being.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa la bstod pa dang / smad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa la bstod pa dang / smad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to praising those who are morally disciplined and blaming those who are morally undisciplined.

original: lan la re ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: lan la re ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to receiving something in return.

original: grags @151b pa dang / sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i phyir sbyin pa med do //ğŸ”½bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa'i sbyin pa med do //

translated: not harming any sentient being, not stealing the possessions of others, not being attached to the spouses of others, not deceiving any sentient being, not being divisive to othersâ€™ retinues, not speaking slanderously, not speaking harshly, not speaking meaninglessly, not being greedy, not being malicious, and not having wrong views.

translated: â€œIt is the morality of generosity because it brings sentient beings to maturity. It is the morality of perfect retention because it is the perfect observance of morality. original: bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi tshogs 'phel bar byed pas bsam gtan gyi tshul khrims dang / thos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas mi ngoms pa'i phyir shes rab kyi tshul khrims dang / thos pa'i snying po len pa'i phyir thos pa'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs spel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yan lag gi tshogs 'phel bar byed pas bsam gtan gyi tshul khrims dang / thos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas mi ngoms pa'i phyir shes rab kyi tshul khrims dang / thos pa'i snying po len pa'i phyir thos pa'i tshul khrims dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs spel ba'i phyir /
translated: It is the morality of concentration because it increases the factors of concentration. It is the morality of insight because it is insatiable in terms of the roots of virtue of listening. original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i tshul khrims dang / lam nyam nga ba 'dor ba'i phyir sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes la rtogs pas lus la mi lta ba'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la brtun te byed pas srog la yid mi rton pa'i tshul khrims dang /

translated: The morality of being without pride is due to being without conceit. The morality of being without agitation is due to being free from desire. translated: It is morality not to impute the body, not to impute the voice, not to impute the mind.

original: gang rtse gcig pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang rtse gcig pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality to be one-pointed, the characteristic of calm abiding.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pas lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la mkhas pas lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality to be skilled in the discernment of phenomena, the characteristic of profound insight.

original: gang stong pa nyid rig pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtha' dang; smon pa med cing khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid rig pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtha' dang; smon pa med cing khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality to be aware of emptiness, to be at the limit of signlessness, to be free from wishes, and not to be mixed up in the three realms.

original: gang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa /ğŸ”½ma skyes pas rab tu phye ba /ğŸ”½mi skye ba la bzod pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa / ma skyes pas rab tu phye ba / mi skye ba la bzod pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality to be non-composite.ğŸ”½It is morality to be distinguished by non-arising.ğŸ”½It is morality to be patient with non-arising.

original: gang ma byas shing bya ba med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang ma byas shing bya ba med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality to be uncreated and not to create.

original: gang sngon gyi mthar mi byed pa dang / phyi ma'i mthar ma 'phos pa dang / bar du mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang sngon gyi mthar mi byed pa dang / phyi ma'i mthar ma 'phos pa dang / bar du mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which does not act in the past, does not pass on to the future, and does not remain in the present.

original: gang sems dri ma med pa dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang sems dri ma med pa dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which is not sullied by the mind, does not dwell in consciousness, and is not mixed with mental activity.

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams la mi rten pa dang / gzugs kyi khams la mi gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na mi 'dug pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams la mi rten pa dang / gzugs kyi khams la mi gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na mi 'dug pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which does not rest in the desire realm, does not abide in the form realm, and does not remain in the formless realm.

original: gang 'dod chags kyi rdul med pa dang / gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / skyon dang / khong khro ba bsal ba dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang / ma rig pa med pa de ni tshul @156b khrims so //
analyzed: gang 'dod chags kyi rdul med pa dang / gnod sems dang / tha ba dang / skyon dang / khong khro ba bsal ba dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang / ma rig pa med pa de ni tshul @156b khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which is free from the dust of desire, free from the poison of anger, free from the fault of pride, free from the darkness of delusion, and free from ignorance.

original: gang rtag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rten nas 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang rtag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rten nas 'byung ba dang mi 'gal ba de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which is not eternal, not annihilated, and does not contradict dependent origination.

original: gang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med pa dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the absence of grasping at â€œIâ€ and â€œmine,â€ and the absence of dwelling on the view of the transitory collection.

original: gang ming dang / brda la mngon par ma zhen pa dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la mi gnas pa dang / ming dang; gzugs dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang ming dang / brda la mngon par ma zhen pa dang / gzugs kyi mtshan nyid la mi gnas pa dang / ming dang; gzugs dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the absence of attachment to names and symbols, the absence of dwelling on the characteristics of form, and the absence of being mixed up with names and forms.

original: gang rgyu'i bag la nyal ba med pa dang / lta ba'i kun nas ldang ba dang / kun nas ma langs pa dang / sgrib pa dang / 'gyod pa la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang rgyu'i bag la nyal ba med pa dang / lta ba'i kun nas ldang ba dang / kun nas ma langs pa dang / sgrib pa dang / 'gyod pa la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the absence of the latent tendencies of causes, the absence of the agitation of views, the absence of dwelling on obscurations and regrets,

original: gang la chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang la chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: and the absence of the basis of the roots of nonvirtue, such as attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: gang mi dga' ba med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang mi dga' ba med pa dang / yongs su gdung ba med pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: The characteristic of morality is that it is not unpleasant, that it is not tormenting, and that it is not agitated.

original: ci bdag gi mig @159b la mig gshe'am zhes bzod pa dang / de bzhin du ci bdag gi rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la yid gshe'am zhes bzod pa de ni skye mched la rtog pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: ci bdag gi mig @159b la mig gshe'am zhes bzod pa dang / de bzhin du ci bdag gi rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la yid gshe'am zhes bzod pa de ni skye mched la rtog pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: â€œIs my eye being harmed by my eye?â€ In the same way, â€œIs my ear being harmed by my ear? Is my nose being harmed by my nose? Is my tongue being harmed by my tongue? Is my body being harmed by my body? Is my mind being harmed by my mind?â€ This is the patience of investigating the sense-spheres.

original: de ni shin tu bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni shin tu bzod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the highest patience.

original: de ni shin tu bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni shin tu bzod pa ma yin no //

original: de ni shin tu bzod pa ma yin no //

translated: But that is not the highest patience.

original: 'di'ang mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'ang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: â€œThis is impermanent.

translated: â€œBy this very enumeration, they serve as many thus-gone ones as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River in order to perfect the perfection of generosity.ğŸ”½Similarly, they serve as many thus-gone ones as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River in order to perfect the perfections of patience, diligence, concentration, and insight.

analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / mtshan dang; dpe byad bzang po thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang /

translated: the aspect of benefiting oneself and others, the aspect of virtuous actions, the aspect of being free from regret, the aspect of making progress, and the aspect of attaining all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thos pa rnam pa brgyad cu rtsa bzhi zhes bya'o //

analyzed: zhi gnas kyi gnas la 'jug pa dang / lhag mthong rnam par dpyod pa'i 'jug pa dang / sems las su rung ba'i 'jug pa dang / lus dben pa @181a *//
translated: engaging in the basis of Å›amatha, engaging in the analysis of vipaÅ›yanÄ, engaging in mental flexibility, engaging in physical isolation,

analyzed: la 'jug pa dang / sems dben pa la 'jug pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'jug pa dang / bden pa'i rjes su mthun pa la 'jug pa dang / chad pa med pa la 'jug pa dang / rtog pa med pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: engaging in mental isolation, engaging in dependent origination, engaging in the conformity with the truths, engaging in the absence of annihilation, engaging in the absence of speculation,

original: rgyu dang / rkyen la 'jug pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / gnas med pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen la 'jug pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang / gang zag med pa la 'jug pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / gnas med pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: engaging in causes and conditions, engaging in the absence of a self, the absence of sentient beings, the absence of a life force, and the absence of a person, and engaging in the absence of coming, going, and remaining.

original: mi 'pho zhing rgyu dang / 'bras bu chud mi za ba la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la 'dris par byed pa la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /ğŸ”½smon pa med pa la mngon sum du mi byed pa la 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa skyad pa'i tshul la 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis mi skye ba la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'pho zhing rgyu dang / 'bras bu chud mi za ba la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la 'dris par byed pa la 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la mngon sum du mi byed pa la 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa skyad pa'i tshul la 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i dbang gis mi skye ba la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the imperishability of causes and effects. It is to engage in becoming familiar with emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. It is to engage in not actualizing emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness. It is to engage in the way of giving rise to the absorptions, the meditative concentrations, and the formless states. It is to engage in not being born through the power of the absorptions, the meditative concentrations, and the formless states.

original: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa dang / nang du rtog pa la 'jug pa dang / nges par gyur par mi 'jug pa la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa dang / nang du rtog pa la 'jug pa dang / nges par gyur par mi 'jug pa la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the wisdom of the higher perceptions. It is to engage in not actualizing the wisdom of the exhaustion of defilements. It is to engage in inner investigation. It is to engage in not engaging in ascertainment.

original: 'dus byas kyi skyon yongs su 'jal ba la 'jug pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon sum du mi byed par 'jug pa @181b dang; sems can thams cad la bdag med par so sor rtog pa la 'jug pa dang / snying rje chen po mi gtong ba la 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi skyon yongs su 'jal ba la 'jug pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon sum du mi byed par 'jug pa @181b dang; sems can thams cad la bdag med par so sor rtog pa la 'jug pa dang / snying rje chen po mi gtong ba la 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in the discernment of the faults of conditioned things. It is to engage in not actualizing unconditioned phenomena. It is to engage in the discernment of the selflessness of all beings. It is to engage in not abandoning great compassion.

original: skye ba thams cad 'jigs par lta ba la 'jug pa dang / rtag tu bsams bzhin du shes pas srid pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin par 'jug pa dang / yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral bar 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kyang mngon sum du mi byed par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba thams cad 'jigs par lta ba la 'jug pa dang / rtag tu bsams bzhin du shes pas srid pa thams cad yongs su 'dzin par 'jug pa dang / yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral bar 'jug pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos kyang mngon sum du mi byed par 'jug pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in seeing all births as terrifying. It is to engage in always holding all existences with the knowledge of intention. It is to engage in disenchantment and freedom from desire. It is to engage in not actualizing the Dharma of freedom from desire.

original: 'dod pa'i dga' ba'i yon tan yal bar 'dor ba la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba mi gtong ba la 'jug pa dang / spros pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong ba la 'jug pa dang / thabs mkhas pa'i spros pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dga' ba'i yon tan yal bar 'dor ba la 'jug pa dang / chos kyi dga' ba mi gtong ba la 'jug pa dang / spros pa dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spong ba la 'jug pa dang / thabs mkhas pa'i spros pa dang /
translated: It is to engage in letting go of the qualities of the pleasures of desire. It is to engage in not forsaking the joy of the Dharma. It is to engage in abandoning all conceptual elaboration and thoughts. It is to engage in the conceptual elaboration of skillful means.ğŸ”½

original: rnam par rtog par mi spong bar 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi spong bar 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is to engage in letting go of the qualities of the pleasures of the desire realm. It is to engage in not letting go of the joy of the Dharma. It is to engage in abandoning all conceptual elaboration and thoughts. It is to engage in not abandoning the conceptual elaboration and thoughts of skillful means.
